item.title: How to Remove Title Bar in Iterm2
item.description: Preview Steps Open Iterm2 Preferences Go to Profiles tab Select your profile Go to Window tab Select No Title Bar from Style dropdown Done!

item.title: How to Make MacOS Terminal Beautiful With Background Image
item.description: IntroductionMacOS’s default Terminal as of it is, is pretty boring and not very good to look at. It’s just some text on a solid background. The easiest way to customise your terminal is to add a background. Following are the steps for the same: Install Iterm2Iterm2 is a terminal emulator, does everything the default Terminal does and more. https://iterm2.com TransparencyIterm -> Preferences -> Profiles -> Window -> Transparency Full screenIterm Preferences -> General -> Window -> Native full screen windows

item.title: How to hide split pane title bars in Iterm2 MacOS
item.description: StepsIterm2 preferences -> Appearance -> Panes -> toggle off show per-pane title bar Before After Other tips Split pane shortcuts Cmd + d - for splitting window vertically Cmd + Shift + d - for splitting window horizontally References Iterm2 Documentation
